moves.1. Nf3: I really like this opening move.
moves.3... f6: Black's next move will probably be e5, I think at this point.
moves.4. Bb5: Threatening his knight with my bishop
moves.6. Bd2: Opening a path for my DSB.
moves.7... e5: He makes the move that I foresaw four moves ago.
moves.8... Be7: For some reason, instead of taking my pawn, instead, he takes out the bishop.
moves.9. exf6: I continue to attack with my pawn.
moves.9... Nxf6: He takes it (but now I have a one-point advantage).
moves.12. Ne4: Moving my knight again to get it out into the fray.
moves.15. Be3: Protecting my king and threatening the queen
moves.16. Kd2: Moving my king so that my rook on h can protect a.
moves.16... Red8+: Putting me in check again. Pesky rooks!
moves.17... Rfe8: Moving his rook to try and trap my bishop.
moves.19... Re7: Threatening my queen; this was a mistake because now I can take the other rook without a problem.
moves.20... Qe8: Moving the queen to protect the king
moves.23... a5: Moving his pawn out (good move because I could have taken it with my bishop.)
moves.24... Rxc4: He takes my pawn, forgetting that I have a rook protecting it.
moves.25. Rxc4: I take the rook, he resigns.
